file.title: Font color

p.text: It specifies the color of the object text.

p.textAll:
All colors can be set in text values (Red, Blue, Black). See more details in the section Quick fill words -> Colors. The color can be also specified in a special form where the tint of the red color is specified firstly, then in semicolumn - the tint of green and at last - the tint of blue. Maximum tint has the value of 255, minimal - 0. For example:
"255; 0; 0;" = red "0; 0; 255;" = blue "0; 0; 0;" = black "255; 255; 255;" = white "255; 255; 128;" = pale yellow

remarks.text: If you want to make the color transparent (not all objects have this option) then set the value "Nothing" or "" for this property.

sample.sampletitle: Variants of how button text color can se set:
sample.samplecode: Window1.Button1.Fore color = red Window1.Button1.Fore color = "255; 201; 128;" Window1.Button1.Fore color = "128;128;0;" Window1.Button1.Fore color = Window1.Button1.Back color
